works.title: Industrial Alcohol Programs in Norway
Work-related drinking and processes of social integration and marginalization in two Norwegian workplaces
abstract: The aim of this study was to investigate the role of drinking in two Norwegian workplaces, focusing on how the drinking may contribute to both social integration and marginalization of employees. The two workplaces were a division of a multinational oil company and a public library both located in one of Norway's larger cities. Data were collected...

works.title: Alkoholproblemer på arbeidsplassen – en arena for tidlig intervensjon via nye medier
abstract: The increasingly easy access to alcohol in Norway has led to a rise in alcohol consumption. The use of alcohol in work-related situations has grown to become a normal feature, espe- cially among persons holding senior positions within business and industry. The economic loss due to employees’ excessive drinking has reached formidable proportions. E...

Rehabilitation of alcoholics and drug addicts: An experimental approach
abstract: Results of an experimental treatment program incorporating social learning theory, behavior therapy and vocational rehabilitation are described.
